metadata.title: CVE-2019-19770 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** In the Linux kernel 4.19.83, there is a use-after-free(read) in the debugfs_remove function in fs/debugfs/inode.c (which is usedto remove a file or directory in debugfs that was previously created with acall to another debugfs function such as debugfs_create_file). NOTE: Linuxkernel developers dispute this issue as not being an issue with debugfs,instead this is an issue with misuse of debugfs within blktrace.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19770` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1103-azure - 4.15.0-1103.114~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-lts-xenial package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1103.114~14.04.1').
